<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Blind-Fight](/Feats.aspx?ID=388) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Fighter" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=71" />
<trait label="Investigator" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=318" />
<trait label="Ranger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=136" />
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=139" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 63 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 173 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Archetypes** [Horizon Walker](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=63) (Level 10), [Exorcist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=171) (Level 10)

**Prerequisites**
master in Perception

</column>

---

Your battle instincts make you more aware of [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) and [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26) opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target concealed creatures. You're not [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) to creatures that are [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) from you (unless you're flat-footed to them for reasons other than the hidden condition), and you need only a successful DC 5 flat check to target a hidden creature.

 While you're adjacent to an [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) creature of your level or lower, it is instead only hidden from you.
name: Blind-Fight
